page.title: 03GLAXO FACTORY, WARE.
page.content: Glaxo is the biggest, British owned, {pharmaceutical company.}The Ware site, of 51 acres, was originally Allen and Hanburys and dates from 1898. There is a{manufacturing}firm, Glaxo Operations UK Ltd. and{research}firm, Glaxo Group Research Ltd. Glaxo Operations employ {980}people, 80% of them living within a 6 mile radius of the firm. About{720 work in Research. The employees work a {5-day week}of 37.5 hours. They can eat a subsidised lunch in the canteen for 65p.There is a sports and social club. Glaxo are one of the largest employers in this area and are currently extend- ing their premises. Goods are taken by road to their warehouses in Greenford. They make{medicines}for treating pain, asthma and blood pressure and have won the{Queen's Award to Industry}3 times, in July'85 for an anti-ulcer drug used by about 20 million people since 1981.
